pysptools.tests.test_SVC.remove_bands(M)[source]¶

Remove the bands with atmospheric scattering. Remove:

[0..4] [102..110] [148..169] [211..end]

pysptools.tests.test_hull module¶

The following classes are tested:
SpectrumConvexHullQuotient FeaturesConvexHullQuotient
pysptools.tests.test_hull.batch_usgs_spec_plot(fname, file_type, path_out)[source]¶

Process the s06av95a_envi file and plot for each spectrum the spectrum, the convex hull and the convex hull quotient.

pysptools.tests.test_hull.extract_features(fname, file_type, path_out, baseline, substance, sample=None)[source]¶

Process the s06av95a_envi file and extract the <substance> and/or <sample> features according to the <baseline> value.

pysptools.tests.test_vd module¶

The following functions are tested:
HfcVd HySime
pysptools.tests.test_vd.dirichlet_rnd(A, dim)[source]¶

Returns a matrix of random numbers chosen from the dirichlet distribution with parameters vector A.

Parameters:A – numpy array A vector of shape parameters.
Returns: numpy array
A matrix of random numbers.
pysptools.tests.test_vd.generate_hyperspectral_data(U, p, N)[source]¶

Generate a simulated hyperspectral data set.

Parameters:
  • U – numpy array USGS library subset.
  • p – int Number of endmembers.
  • N – int Number of pixels.
Returns: (numpy array, numpy array)
  • x is the signal (endmembers linear mixture)
  • s abundance fractions (Nxp)
pysptools.tests.test_vd.get_random_n_endmembers(fname, file_type, n)[source]¶
pysptools.tests.test_vd.test_HfcVd(data)[source]¶
pysptools.tests.test_vd.test_hysime(data)[source]¶
pysptools.tests.test_vd.test_synthetic_hypercube(lib_file_type)[source]¶

Test a synthetic hypercube made with p endmembers taken to the USGS library. Maybe the USGS library is not a good source of endmembers. Same mineral species can have a very similar signature. Picking a random subset can return some nearly identical signatures.

There is no noise added.

In general, the results are good for both HySime and HfcVd for small values of p.

pysptools.tests.test_vd.tests()[source]¶
